timeline.bodyText:
How about adding some documentation to this method.
Calculates the simple-name based on the type of the passed {@code element}.
If the {@code element} is an instance of {@code EObject}, the value of the {@code name} attribute is returned.
If the {@code element} is an instance of {@code IEObjectDescription}, the value of the {@link QualifiedName#getLastSegment()} is returned.
A {@code null} value is returned otherwise.
timeline.author: nbhusare

timeline.bodyText: Please use a simple for-loop so that we can get rid of the the reference to the IterableExtensions type.

timeline.bodyText: I believe, we don't need this check here. The call to resolveCrossReferencedElementAt(...) on line 59 would return a null value if the XtextResource#getParseResult() is null.

timeline.message:
[eclipse/xtext#1679] ported xtend code to java

Signed-off-by: Christian Dietrich <christian.dietrich@itemis.de>

timeline.bodyText: Should be a ConcurrentHashMap, otherwise the synchronization attempt in get(String) is completely flawed
timeline.author: szarnekow

replies.bodyText: why? there is a second read in the synchronized
replies.author: cdietrich

replies.bodyText: Thread A calls get, sees nothing and enters the synchronize block, calls get again, sees still nothing and starts to put things into the map (this is not an atomic operation). While the map is being modified, Thread B calls get and sees an inconsistent map state. This can be avoided by using a ConcurrentHashMap + computeIfAbsent
replies.author: szarnekow

replies.bodyText: sry. can we do this in a separate PR. i am not able to think this properly through right now
replies.author: cdietrich

timeline.author: szarnekow
szarnekow
szarnekow

since the issues iterable is not empty, minBySeverity cannot be null.
Could be simplified to  return IterableExtensions.minBy(..).severity
